body_html:
Thanks for the update, and I'm glad that sin will be in there soon!

Regarding cross--it's certainly possible to build out of existing XLA blocks, but my concern was speed. Is that not a valid concern? TF-level cross can be defined pretty easily indeed:

with tf.op_scope([u, v], name, 'cross') as scope:
    u_t = tf.transpose(u)
    v_t = tf.transpose(v)

    u1, u2, u3 = tf.unstack(u_t)
    v1, v2, v3 = tf.unstack(v_t)

    return tf.transpose(tf.stack([(u2 * v3) - (u3 * v2), (u3 * v1) - (u1 * v3), (u1 * v2) - (u2 * v1)]))

I'm asking so that I know whether to start a new issue or not. Thanks.

body:
Thanks for the update, and I'm glad that `sin` will be in there soon!

Regarding `cross`--it's certainly possible to build out of existing XLA blocks, but my concern was speed. Is that not a valid concern? TF-level cross can be defined pretty easily indeed:

```
with tf.op_scope([u, v], name, 'cross') as scope:
    u_t = tf.transpose(u)
    v_t = tf.transpose(v)

    u1, u2, u3 = tf.unstack(u_t)
    v1, v2, v3 = tf.unstack(v_t)

    return tf.transpose(tf.stack([(u2 * v3) - (u3 * v2), (u3 * v1) - (u1 * v3), (u1 * v2) - (u2 * v1)]))
```

I'm asking so that I know whether to start a new issue or not. Thanks.
